str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
At one time or other, at some time, formerly. From the base of pou and te; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Foolish, thoughtless. By implication, sensual.
Unbelieving, disobedient, who will not be persuaded. Unpersuadable, i.e. Contumacious.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
And, even, also, namely.
From handano; sensual delight; by implication, desire.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (either trans. or intrans.), I spend time, pass time, live. From dia and ago; to pass time or life.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From kakos; badness, i.e. depravity, or malignity, or trouble.
And, even, also, namely.
Envy, a grudge, spite. Probably akin to the base of phtheiro; ill-will, i.e. Jealousy.
Hateful, detestable, disgusting. From a derivative of an obsolete apparently primary stugo; hated, i.e. Odious.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
